sen.j: 本多 康重（ほんだ やすしげ、1554年（天文 (元号)23年）- 1611年5月4日（慶長16年3月22日 (旧暦)））は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Yasushige HONDA (1554 - 1611 May 4) is a busho (Japanese military commander) from the Sengoku period (Japan).
Yasushige HONDA (1554 - May 4, 1611) is a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (Japan).
sen.cmt: 年と月の順番を変更しました。from→inに変更しました。
sen.e: Yasushige HONDA (1554 - May 4, 1611) is a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period (Japan).
Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) from the early Edo period.
Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the early Edo period.
Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 三河国岡崎藩の初代藩主。
sen.e: First lord of Okazaki Domain, Mikawa Province.
First lord of Okazaki Domain, Mikawa Province.
First lord of Okazaki Domain, Mikawa Province.
First lord of the Honda family of the Hirotaka side.
First lord of the Honda family of the Hirotaka side.
First lord of the Honda family of the Hirotaka side.
First son of Hirotaka HONDA.
First son of Hirotaka HONDA.
First son of Hirotaka HONDA.

sen.j: 母は東条松平義春の娘。
sen.e: His mother is the daughter of Tojo Yoshiharu MATSUDAIRA.
His mother is the daughter of Tojo Yoshiharu MATSUDAIRA.
His mother is the daughter of Tojo Yoshiharu MATSUDAIRA.
The lawful wife is the daughter of Ienari ISHIKAWA.
His lawful wife is the daughter of Ienari ISHIKAWA.
His lawful wife is the daughter of Ienari ISHIKAWA.

sen.j: 子に本多康紀（長男）、本多紀貞（三男）、本多重世（四男）、娘（諏訪頼水正室）、娘（飛鳥井雅庸室）、娘（堀利重正室）、娘（遠藤慶勝正室）ら。
sen.e: His children are Yasunori HONDA (eldest son), Norisada HONDA (third son), Shigeyoshi HONDA (fourth son), daughter (lawful wife of Yorimizu SUWA), daughter (lawful wife of Masatsune ASUKAI), daughter (lawful wife of Toshishige HORI), daughter (lawful wife of Yoshikatsu ENDO) etc.

His children are Yasunori HONDA (eldest son), Norisada HONDA (third son), Shigeyoshi HONDA (fourth son), a daughter (lawful wife of Yorimizu SUWA), a daughter (lawful wife of Masatsune ASUKAI), a daughter (lawful wife of Toshishige HORI), a daughter (lawful wife of Yoshikatsu ENDO) etc.

His children are Yasunori HONDA (eldest son), Norisada HONDA (third son), Shigeyoshi HONDA (fourth son), a daughter (lawful wife of Yorimizu SUWA), a daughter (lawful wife of Masatsune ASUKAI), a daughter (lawful wife of Toshishige HORI), a daughter (lawful wife of Yoshikatsu ENDO) etc.

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、豊後国守。
sen.e: Official court rank is junior fifth rank, Bungo no kuni no kami (Governor of Bungo Province).
His official court rank is junior fifth rank, lower grade, Bungo no kuni no kami (Governor of Bungo Province).
sen.cmt: hisを追加しました。lower gradeを追加しました。
sen.e: His official court rank is junior fifth rank, lower grade, Bungo no kuni no kami (Governor of Bungo Province).
His common name is Hikojiro.
His common name is Hikojiro.
His common name is Hikojiro.

sen.j: 早くから徳川家康に仕えて姉川の戦いや武田信玄との戦いに従軍して戦功を挙げた。
sen.e: From his early times he served for Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and raised his army for the Battle of Anegawa and battle with Shingen TAKEDA, and was known for his distinguished war service.
From his early times he served for Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and raised his army for the Battle of Anegawa and battle with Shingen TAKEDA, and was known for his distinguished war service.
From his early times he served for Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and raised his army for the Battle of Anegawa and battle with Shingen TAKEDA, and was known for his distinguished war service.

sen.j: 小田原征伐後に家康が関東に移されると、上野国白井藩にて2万石を与えられた。
sen.e: Once Ieyasu gets transferred to Kanto after the conquest and siege of Odawara, he receives 20,000 koku by Mikawa Okazaki clan.
Once Ieyasu got transferred to Kanto after the conquest and siege of Odawara, he received 20,000 koku in Shiroi Domain of Kozuke Province.
sen.cmt: 上野国白井藩に変更しました。時制を変更しました。
sen.e: Once Ieyasu got transferred to Kanto after the conquest and siege of Odawara, he received 20,000 koku in Shiroi Domain of Kozuke Province.

sen.j: 関ヶ原の合戦後の慶長6年（1601年）には三河岡崎藩に5万石を与えられた。
sen.e: After the battle of Sekigahara in 1601, he received 50,000 koku by Mikawa Okazaki clan.
After the battle of Sekigahara in 1601, he received 50,000 koku in Okazaki Domain of Mikawa Province.
sen.cmt: 「三河岡崎藩に」の部分を変更しました。
sen.e: After the battle of Sekigahara in 1601, he received 50,000 koku in Okazaki Domain of Mikawa Province.

sen.j: 慶長16年（1611年）3月22日、58歳で死去し、後を長男・康紀が継いだ。
sen.e: In 1611 March 22, he dies at the age of 58, and the eldest son Yasunori succeeds after.
On April 24, 1611, he died at the age of 58, and the eldest son Yasunori succeeded him.
sen.cmt: 新暦に変更しました。after→himに変更しました。
sen.e: On April 24, 1611, he died at the age of 58, and the eldest son Yasunori succeeded him.

sen.j: 墓所：静岡県掛川市横須賀の撰要寺。
sen.e: Graveyard : Senyo-ji Temple located at Yokosuka, Kakegawa City, Shizuoka Prefecture.
Graveyard : Senyo-ji Temple located at Yokosuka, Kakegawa City, Shizuoka Prefecture.
